intro: Leonohebe propinqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf leonohebe, is a perennial shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
